Connected Alumni Benefits and Services Alumni Award Programs and Events                                                        NYU Schack's 46th Annual Conference On Capital Markets Features New 'Battle of the Titans' Keynote Panel                             Panels to focus on opportunities, sovereign debt, ongoing impact of the U.S. financial crisis, and more          NEW YORK, October 15, 2013 —The NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate will host its 46th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate titled We're Back:  Leadership's Guide to Capturing Opportunities in the Global Real Estate Markets on Wednesday, October 30, 2013 at The Pierre. Among the exciting changes to the agenda this year, the conference will include a new "Battle of the Titans" keynote panel. Six thought-provoking panels, plus a one-on-one session, will cover various topics in capital markets including new opportunities, sovereign debt, the ongoing impact of the U.S. financial crisis and other current trends in the marketplace.   The Battle of the Titans panel, " Mega Developments in the Magical City of Oz, " will feature real estate luminaries David R. Greenbaum, President, New York Division, Vornado Realty Trust; Marty S. Burger, Co-Chief Executive Officer, Silverstein Properties, Inc.; L. Jay Cross, President, Related Hudson Yards; MaryAnne Gilmartin, President and Chief Executive Officer, Forest City Ratner Companies; and Dennis Friedrich , Chief Executive Officer, Brookfield Office Properties.   This year's conference chair is Robert S. Blumenthal   Managing Director, Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. and Executive Committee Member, NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate. Co-chairs are: Jeffrey A. Barclay Managing Director, Goldman, Sachs & Co.; Executive Committee Member, NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate; Richard A. Kessle r Chief Operating Officer, Benenson Capital Partners, LLC; Executive Committee Member and Adjunct Associate Professor, NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate; and John Z. Kukra l President and Chief Executive Officer, Northwood Investors.   Jonathan D. Gray, Global Head of Real Estate, Blackstone, will be featured in the one-on-one panel moderated by James D. Kuhn , president of Newmark Grubb Knight Frank and chairman of the NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate Advisory Board.   This year's "NYC: We Are the Golden Apple" panel will focus on the challenges and opportunities for continued supremacy in real estate markets. As in previous years, this panel will close out the conference with New York City real estate royalty, including Marc Holliday , Chief Executive Officer of SL Green Realty; William L. Mack , Chairman of Mack Real Estate Group; Scott Rechler , Chairman and Chief Executive Office, RXR Realty LLC, and Vice Chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (Governor Andrew M. Cuomo's Senior Representative on the Board); William C. Rudin , Vice Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Rudin Management Company, Inc.; and Larry A. Silverstein , president and Chief Executive Officer of Silverstein Properties, Inc. and Founder and Chairman Emeritus of the NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate. This panel will be moderated by Robert S. Blumenthal .   Other panels featuring the industry's leaders will focus on liquidity, international equity and sovereign investment funds, permanent capital and structured finance, global real estate outlook and the next generation of young drivers of equity.   "Every year, NYU Schack's Capital Markets Conference gathers some of the best and brightest minds in the industry to share insights and information that is relevant and timely for real estate professionals," said Rosemary Scanlon, divisional dean of the NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate. "This year's panelists will give everyone new ideas to think about and the opportunity to network with some of the most prominent names in New York real estate. We look forward to what promises to be one of the most-well-attended conferences of the year."   The conference begins at 8 a.m. Registration is now open.   To view the complete conference agenda and to register, please visit: scps.nyu.edu/capital .       FULL PANEL LIST   Liquidity is Back: The Expanding Universe of the Real Estate Capital Markets    Moderator:     Richard A. Kessler , Chief Operating Officer, Benenson Capital Partners, LLC     Panelists:     Charles ("Chip") H. Fedalen, Jr. , Executive Vice President and Group Head, Commercial Real Estate, Wells Fargo   Mark Finerman , President, LoanCore Capital, LLC   Greta Guggenheim , Founding Partner and Chief Investment Officer, Ladder Capital Finance LLC   David A. Tyler Henritze , Senior Managing Director, Blackstone   Adam Schwartz , Managing Director – Head of U.S. Real Estate, Angelo, Gordon & Co. Barclay, Managing Director, Goldman, Sachs & Co.     Panelists:     Sean Bannon , Managing Director, Head of US Real Estate, Zurich Alternative Asset Management, LLC.   Additional speakers TBA       New York City: We are the Golden Apple:  Challenges and Opportunities for   Continued Real Estate Supremacy on the Globe   Moderator:     Robert S. Blumenthal , Managing Director, Deutsche Bank Securities Inc.     Panelists:     Marc Holliday , Chief Executive Officer, SL Green Realty   William L. Mack, Chairman, Mack Real Estate group   Scott Rechler , Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, RXR Realty LLC; Vice Chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, Governor Cuomo's Senior Representative on the Board   William C. Rudin , Vice Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Rudin Management Company, Inc.   Larry A. Silverstein , President & Chief Executive Officer, Silverstein Properties, Inc.              About the NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate        The NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate ( scps.nyu.edu/schack ) was founded in 1967, at the initiative of prominent real estate leaders who encouraged NYU to establish an academic center that provided an educational foundation for professionals within their industry. Today, NYU Schack offers graduate degrees—notably the M.S. in Real Estate, the M.S. in Construction Management, and the M.S. in Real Estate Development—as well as graduate certificates in real estate and construction management, all of which enroll nearly 800 full- and part-time students from more than 30 countries and boast over 3,000 graduates around the globe. The Schack Institute recently launched a new B.S. in Real Estate. In addition, each year, approximately 4,200 working professionals enroll in the Institute's professional certificate programs, noncredit courses, and licensure-related offerings in such areas as real estate finance, sales and brokerage, sustainable design, facilities management, and architecture and civil engineering. The Institute also houses the NYU REIT Center and the Center for the Sustainable Built Environment, and hosts key industry events, including annual conferences on real estate capital markets and REITs. NYU Schack is one of several academic divisions within the School of Continuing and Professional Studies (NYU-SCPS), which offers a broad range of professionally focused undergraduate, graduate, and noncredit offerings.                About the NYU School of Continuing and Professional Studies            Established in 1934, NYU-SCPS ( scps.nyu.edu ) is one of NYU’s several degree-granting schools and colleges, each with a unique academic profile. The reputation of NYU-SCPS arises from its place as the NYU home for study and applied research related to key knowledge-based industries where the New York region leads globally. This is manifest in the School’s diverse graduate, undergraduate, and noncredit programs in fields such as Real Estate, Real Estate Development, and Construction Management; Hospitality, Tourism, and Sports Management; Global Affairs; Fundraising and Grantmaking; Publishing; Professional Writing; Human Resource Management and Development, Marketing, Public Relations and Corporate Communication, Management and Systems, Advanced Digital Applications, Graphic Communications Management and Technology, Project Management, and Accounting, Finance, and Law; Liberal and Allied Arts; Foreign Languages, Translation, and Interpreting; Applied Politics; and Health Information Management.    More than 100 distinguished full-time faculty members collaborate with an exceptional cadre of practitioner/adjunct faculty and lecturers to create vibrant professional and academic networks that annually attract nearly 5,000 degree-seeking students from around the globe. In addition, the School fulfills the recurrent continuing higher education needs of local and professional communities, as evidenced by close to 48,000 annual noncredit enrollments in individual courses, specialized certificate programs, workshops, and seminars. The School’s community is enriched by more than 27,000 degree-holding alumni worldwide, many of whom serve as mentors, guest speakers, and advisory board members. For more information, visit: scps.nyu.edu .        London/NY Dialogue            REIT Symposium            Sustainable Real Estate Conference            Urban Leadership Award Dinner                                                                                                   47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate                              The Millennial Real Estate Generation: Cyber Age Approach to Investing, Financing, Shopping, and Living              The expansion of the global real estate capital markets for senior/subordinated debt and public/private equity has ignited financing, acquisition, and development beyond historic peaks. Opportunities abound as liquidity flows in the U.S. and investors seek compelling investment returns amidst European market recovery.   The real estate landscape is being transformed by new drivers of demand and productivity from the "millennial generation," our largest cohort of deep-pocketed, sophisticated consumers. Their desire for individual freedom, work-life flexibility, and access to communal social networking space and technology is creating new waves of dynamism in the office, residential, retail, and hospitality real estate sectors.   Join real estate leaders and a deep bench of other industry participants at the 47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate on November 19, 2014.         Conference Information     Date: November 19, 2014   Location: The Pierre Hotel   Grand Ballroom   New York, NY               Sponsorship Opportunities            For inquiries on sponsorship opportunities, please contact Jessica Estrada-Watson at jessica.watson@nyu.edu or call (212) 992-3618 .              Chair        Robert S. Blumenthal  Managing Director, Deutsche Bank Securities Inc.;  Executive Committee Member, Schack Institute of Real Estate                Co-Chairs          Jeffrey A. Barclay  Managing Director, Goldman, Sachs & Co.;  Executive Committee Member, Schack Institute of Real Estate           Richard A. About the NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate        The NYU Schack Institute of Real Estate ( scps.nyu.edu/schack ) was founded in 1967, at the initiative of prominent real estate leaders who encouraged NYU to establish an academic center that provided an educational foundation for professionals within their industry. Today, NYU Schack offers graduate degrees—notably the M.S. in Real Estate, the M.S. in Construction Management, and the M.S. in Real Estate Development—as well as graduate certificates in real estate and construction management, all of which enroll nearly 800 full- and part-time students from more than 30 countries and boast over 3,000 graduates around the globe. The Schack Institute recently launched a new B.S. in Real Estate. In addition, each year, approximately 4,200 working professionals enroll in the Institute's professional certificate programs, noncredit courses, and licensure-related offerings in such areas as real estate finance, sales and brokerage, sustainable design, facilities management, and architecture and civil engineering. The Institute also houses the NYU REIT Center and the Center for the Sustainable Built Environment, and hosts key industry events, including annual conferences on real estate capital markets and REITs. NYU Schack is one of several academic divisions within the School of Continuing and Professional Studies (NYU-SCPS), which offers a broad range of professionally focused undergraduate, graduate, and noncredit offerings.                About the NYU School of Continuing and Professional Studies            Established in 1934, NYU-SCPS ( scps.nyu.edu ) is one of NYU’s several degree-granting schools and colleges, each with a unique academic profile. The reputation of NYU-SCPS arises from its place as the NYU home for study and applied research related to key knowledge-based industries where the New York region leads globally. This is manifest in the School’s diverse graduate, undergraduate, and noncredit programs in fields such as Real Estate, Real Estate Development, and Construction Management; Hospitality, Tourism, and Sports Management; Global Affairs; Fundraising and Grantmaking; Publishing; Professional Writing; Human Resource Management and Development, Marketing, Public Relations and Corporate Communication, Management and Systems, Advanced Digital Applications, Graphic Communications Management and Technology, Project Management, and Accounting, Finance, and Law; Liberal and Allied Arts; Foreign Languages, Translation, and Interpreting; Applied Politics; and Health Information Management.    More than 100 distinguished full-time faculty members collaborate with an exceptional cadre of practitioner/adjunct faculty and lecturers to create vibrant professional and academic networks that annually attract nearly 5,000 degree-seeking students from around the globe. In addition, the School fulfills the recurrent continuing higher education needs of local and professional communities, as evidenced by close to 48,000 annual noncredit enrollments in individual courses, specialized certificate programs, workshops, and seminars. The School’s community is enriched by more than 27,000 degree-holding alumni worldwide, many of whom serve as mentors, guest speakers, and advisory board members. For more information, visit: scps.nyu.edu .                                     47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate                              The Millennial Real Estate Generation: Cyber Age Approach to Investing, Financing, Shopping, and Living              The expansion of the global real estate capital markets for senior/subordinated debt and public/private equity has ignited financing, acquisition, and development beyond historic peaks. Opportunities abound as liquidity flows in the U.S. and investors seek compelling investment returns amidst European market recovery.   The real estate landscape is being transformed by new drivers of demand and productivity from the "millennial generation," our largest cohort of deep-pocketed, sophisticated consumers. Their desire for individual freedom, work-life flexibility, and access to communal social networking space and technology is creating new waves of dynamism in the office, residential, retail, and hospitality real estate sectors.   Join real estate leaders and a deep bench of other industry participants at the 47th Annual Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate on November 19, 2014.         Conference Information     Date: November 19, 2014   Location: The Pierre Hotel   Grand Ballroom   New York, NY               Sponsorship Opportunities            For inquiries on sponsorship opportunities, please contact Jessica Estrada-Watson at jessica.watson@nyu.edu or call (212) 992-3618 .
